attributes.action: give up this mindless proposal to increase the maximum time terror suspects can be held from 28 to 42 days
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It seems regrettable that a government, which spends so much time stating how it never gives in to “Terrorism”, is effectively doing so by approving this amendment.
By forcefully eroding civil liberties in this way the government is actually pandering to "terrorist" ideology.
The most important element is that the government should legislate according to the demands of its citizens, in the absence of a referendum (which would obviously be out of the question logistically); the executive should turn to its experts. Unless these experts are lying to the faces of the UK media, then appears the experts that the executive should be gleaning counsel from are being ignored.
Sir Ken Macdonald (Director of Public Prosecutions) says 42 days is not needed.
Here are some useful quotes from a leading Uk broadsheet.
"MPs on the home affairs select committee say there is no evidence to suggest that the 28-day limit needs to be extended."
